name: codemirror
description: CodeMirror as a VS Code extension.

codemirror.extensions.description: VS Code commands to execute to get CodeMirror extensions.

codemirror.lang.html.autoCloseTags.markdownDescription: Determines whether `autoCloseTags` is included in the support extensions. Defaults to true.

codemirror.lang.html.matchClosingTags.markdownDescription: By default, the syntax tree will highlight mismatched closing tags. Set this to `false` to turn that off (for example when you expect to only be parsing a fragment of HTML text, not a full document).

codemirror.lang.markdown.completeHTMLTag.markdownDescription: By default, the extension installs an autocompletion source that completes HTML tags when a `<` is typed. Set this to false to disable this.

codemirror.lang.php.plain.markdownDescription: By default, PHP parsing only starts at the first `<?` marker. When you set this to true, it starts immediately at the start of the document.

codemirror.lang.sql.defaultSchema.markdownDescription: When given, tables prefixed with this schema name can be completed directly at the top level.

codemirror.lang.sql.defaultTable.markdownDescription: When given, columns from the named table can be completed directly at the top level.

codemirror.lang.sql.upperCaseKeywords.markdownDescription: When set to true, keyword completions will be upper-case.

codemirror.lang.xml.autoCloseTags.markdownDescription: Determines whether `autoCloseTags` is included in the support extensions. Defaults to true.

scripts.build: npm run readme && npm run svg && npm run png && npm run dist && npm run vsix
